text: .@SenRobRodriguez Mobile home park residents, who often live on fixed incomes, will continue to be priced out of their homes and communities if current practices continue. Vote YES on HB22-1287 to keep our families, homes, and communities together. #coleg

author: Kevin Abels
text: “Unions are 1 of the only ways workers can stand up + get their rights,” says Medina, an active organizer in the successful union campaign that was led by @amazonlabor. ​“Union busting hinders the rights of the most oppressed, bc unions are how oppressed workers come together.”😍

author: Kevin Abels
Kevin Abels
text: Direct action gets the goods! 👀After 4 mos of bargaining, Kroger agreed to raises of 19%-31% for most workers. “The companies were afraid of a strike. Our members were more unified & militant than they’ve been in a long time,”-Kathy Finn, sec-treas/@UFCW770 🤩 https://t.co/JPPiXXtsr5

author: Kevin Abels
text: Drug overdoses have increased especially in states that felonize possession. Why go back to failed policies? Let’s invest in a healthier, safer, more compassionate CO #JustSayNoToRefelonization @AlecGarnett @LindseyForCO @benavidezhd32 @KerryTipperHD28 @Dylan_RobertsCO

author: Kevin Abels
text: “20/24 have struck for 3 wks. 20 have signed union cards... If we are serious about democracy in the workplace, we should not allow an employer to force an election to determine what those workers want. They are already telling us.” ✊🏿✊🏼✊🏾@coffee_comrades

author: Kevin Abels
text: “Think of Joy Silk as a voting rights measure for workplace democracy. It is not a structural shift, but it does about as much as the board can to make elections fairer.” https://t.co/R23Nrtl1wJ

author: Kevin Abels
text: “when a conservative NLRB declared that an employer could simply insist on an election & reject any other proof of union majority…It did not take long for businesses to transform the election process into a union-busting tool. In ‘16–17, they committed ULPs in >41.5% elections”

author: Kevin Abels
text: “NLRB-run elections are exercises in anti-democracy. The process effectively functions as opp for employers to coerce workers thru anti-union tactics (legal & otherwise). This perverse legal regime—elections as a tool of repression—has served to quash union drives for decades.” https://t.co/vrR8LDCFbP

author: Kevin Abels
text: Is “fuggedabawdit” 2 words? https://t.co/CWyiJeYM6X

author: Kevin Abels
text: ‘So much for the Supreme Court’s holding that the State holds title to the bed of navigable streams ​“in trust for the people of the state, that they may … have the liberty of fishing therein.”’ Time to switch sides @pweiser and support public rights to OUR rivers!

author: Kevin Abels
text: “…At various times, Attorney General @pweiser has somewhat astoundingly argued that there are no navigable rivers in Colorado, and that even if there were, the state may deny public access to navigable riverbeds.” 🤦‍♂️ I’m no lawyer but I’ve been on plenty of rafting trips in CO

author: Kevin Abels
text: “⁦@pweiser⁩ joined the case on the side of the private landowners & has moved aggressively against Hill, seeking not just to deny his right to fish from the bed of the river, but also to claim that Hill doesn’t have the right to even be in court... https://t.co/Z0WUG8ClmS

author: Kevin Abels
text: Hello @Starbucks CEO @Kevin_Johnson. Coffee with a side of union-busting? Firing Memphis workers in retaliation for their efforts to join together in union? Restore their jobs immediately! I support their right to join together & have a voice on the job.
